monster.name: Malar - God of the Hunt
languages: Common
Uncommon
Ancient
Nature

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Malar attacks with his claws 3 times, making an attack roll for each:{@atk mw} {@hit 26} to hit, reach 1 m, one target.{@h}{@damage 3d4 + 5} piercing/slashing damage.

action.name: Pocket Pistol
entries: Malar attacks with his trusty pistol.{@atk rw} {@hit 26} to hit, range 0/20/2k m, one target.{@h}{@damage 2d10 + 11} piercing damage.

action.name: Long Shot
entries: Malar attacks with one of his hunting rifles.{@atk rw} {@hit 26} to hit, range 5/2k/10k m, one target.{@h}{@damage 3d12 + 11} piercing damage.

trait.name: Quick one to Act
entries: Malar can use Actions (with the exception of Long Shot) with his Bonus Action as well.

trait.name: Muscle Memory Reflexes
entries: You now have 3 Reactions each turn, instead of 1.

trait.name: Ambush Master
entries: You excel at leading ambushes and acting first in a fight. You have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, the first creature you hit during the firstround of a combat becomes easier for you and others to strike. Attack rolls against that target have advantage until the end of your next turn.When using sided Initiative, you and any creature with this ability also gets a free turn at the start of a fight.

trait.name: Blindsense
entries: You know how to see without actual vision. You can see the area and location of enemies in a range of 5 meter range around you through sound and vibrations. This does not work through any sort of wall including glass.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: You can attack someone without them really noticing what happened or from where. You gain +4 damage on attacks you have advantage on, or when another friendly creature is withing melee range of the enemy you are attacking. Sneak attacks now also ignore flat DR.

trait.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: While you sometimes can't evade an attack, you can position yourself in such a way that it won't hit like intended. You can use your Reaction to halve the damage of an attack that you can see. When you use this ability on another creature than yourself, then that creature needs to be in melee range of you, and both you and the creature take half of the attacks damage.

trait.name: Bolt-Bonus
entries: You can do bolt-loading/unloading as a Bonus Action instead of as an Action, meaning that weapons with the Bolt-Action trait don't effect you anymore.

trait.name: Let's Get Critical
entries: You have the ability to specifically aim for weak spots. You can choose to use your Bonus Action to gain disadvantage with attack rolls on this turn, which cannot be negated normally, which includes rolling more D20's by other means. When you choose to use this ability, a hit will count as a critical hit, doubling the damage dice(s) you roll. When this ability is active, a natural 20 will not negate AC in the way it normally does.(If you roll a 20+3 with this ability active, but the target has 25 AC, than it won't be a hit.)

trait.name: Running Hell
entries: You get used to running over obstacles that are in your way. You gain +1 meter movement, and obstacles (desks, benches, chairs, railings and the like) can be easily jumped over without the need of a Dexterity save. Also, your long jumps now also add your Dexterity modifier to the maximum distance. And you can now also use your Bonus Action to get up from being {@condition prone}, instead of using your Action.

legendary.name: All out Attack
entries: All damage rolls will roll the maximum value

legendary.name: Done with the Action
entries: Malar can teleport away from the fight as a free action.

legendary.name: A Swing and a Miss
entries: Malar can use a free action to completely dodge a non-laser based ranged attack.

legendaryHeader: Malar can take 5 legendary actions per day, and can only use one once per turn.

monster.name: Tribal Pollop
languages: Musi

trait.name: Plant Life
entries: Pollops are sentient plants which can, like most other creatures, control most of their body. Pollops don’t have legs or arms, but they stand on a bunch of thick tentacle like vines which they can use as arms for manipulating things as well. Because of this, they don’t have hands or fingers, but will still be able to manipulate most things normally that don’t directly need fingers to use. Also, they can hold quite a lot things at once, as they aren’t limited by two arms and hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 0.5 m, one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4+1}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Little Helper (Tiny, Sapient)
languages: *same as it's owner - can only speak simple frases

trait.name: Little Helper
entries: A mechanical version of any small animal, or a higher tech version of a commerical RC drone for example. It is around 200 grams and it is one of the variants below:

variant.name: Standard
entries:
The standard issue, and because of that the most stable.
For every 10 HP base it has, it gets 5 HP more.

variant.name: Flying
entries: It gets a flying speed equal to its walking speed.

variant.name: Heavy
entries:
The little helper is a massive ground based drone.
This is mosty because of extra armor that the hull has, and so it gains +1 AC en +2 natural DR.
It's weight is also doubled.

variant.name: Swift
entries:
The little helper is a very manouvrable ground based drone.
This is because it is especially made to move easily, and so it gains +1 AC and 0.5 meter extra movement.

variant.name: Other
entries: This Tiny Helper is unique, and is made in an unusual way.
The Tiny Helper can be slightly different than normal, which can be discussed with the DM.
